page.title: 17Garden Birds in Fulford
page.content: House sparrows inhabit different areas around Fulford, from farmland to heathland but its normal home is near the city where it can find food in harsh winters. Starlings are common in Fulford. Flocks of them greedily eat almost anything but their favourite foods are leather jackets. they nest in trees, bushes and hedgerows. Black- birds feed on worms, beetles and other invertebrates. They nest in trees and hedges. Robins are very tame in the gardens of Fulford. They are very protective over their territory, often nesting in dense undergrowth or bushes. Bluetits are clever birds who have learnt to take milk bottle tops off to get at the cream. Their favourite nest sites are hollow trees but so many trees have been felled that they have taken to nesting in artificial nest boxes.
